thread.title: Heels Too Much for 'Hoos, Cavs Fall 26-13 at UNC
thread.title_full: Heels Too Much for 'Hoos, Cavs Fall 26-13 at UNC

title: Heels Too Much for 'Hoos, Cavs Fall 26-13 at UNC
text:
Heels Too Much for 'Hoos, Cavs Fall 26-13 at UNC - NBC29 WVIR Charlottesville, VA News, Sports and Weather Member Center: Heels Too Much for 'Hoos, Cavs Fall 26-13 at UNC Posted: Updated: UNC's Elijah Hood rushed for 101 yards and two touchdowns in the Tar Heels 26-13 win over UVa CHARLOTTESVILLE, Va (WVIR) - 
North Carolina's Elijah Hood rushed for 101 yards and two touchdowns and UNC topped Virginia 26-13 from Chapel Hill, to extend its winning streak to six straight over the 'Hoos. 
Virginia dropped to 2-5 on the season and 1-2 in the ACC. UVa's opponents are a combined 26-7 and the Cavaliers have now lost 13 straight road games. 
'Hoos junior Quarterback Matt Johns threw for 148 yards, one touchdown and a season-high four interceptions in the loss. Taquan 'Smoke' Mizzell led the ground attack with 117 yards on 24 carries. Mizzell also led the team in receiving with six receptions for 57 yards. 
Graduate student T.J. Thorpe, who transferred from UNC this off season, caught just two passes for eleven yards. 
Virginia's defense came up with its first interception of the season when sophomore safety Quin Blanding intercepted Marquis Williams in the second quarter. Blanding's interception led to a 26 yard Ian Frye field goal, which tied the game 13-13 at the half. 
Head coach Mike London says, "There's no small victories. Its all about the wins. Obviously they're number one in scoring in many offensive categories. I think defensively we did a good job at times. Obviously, they scored more points than we did and ended up winning the game." 
Senior defensive end Mike Moore says, "Its definitely tough. Its definitely frustrating also with what we did both defensively and offensively. We just have to get back into the film room and fix every bit." 
Johns says, "We were in it. Its not like they were that much better than us. Our defense played their hearts out. Unfortunately, the offense didn't get it done today." 
Virginia finished with five total turnovers to North Carolina's two and was out-gained 422 to 353 yards. 
The Cavaliers return to Scott Stadium Halloween Saturday to host Georgia Tech for a 3:00 p.m. kick off. Heels Too Much for 'Hoos, Cavs Fall 26-13 at UNC More>>
